title: 'Asked PM not to come to House': LS Speaker says plot by Cong MPs to create 'inappropriate incident'
summary: Lok Sabha was adjourned amid security concerns over alleged Congress plans to attack Prime Minister Narendra Modi, despite his presence. Opposition rejected the claims, accusing the government of stalling proceedings. The Prime Minister is expected to address the Rajya Sabha later.

title: Will India stop buying Russian oil? MEA clarifies India's 'core strategy'
Ghaziabad sisters' suicide: 'Death better than beatings', daughters wrote in diary
summary: Three sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, died after falling from the ninth floor of their Ghaziabad apartment building. A neighbor witnessed the eldest sister on the window ledge with the younger two holding her, before they all fell. Police are investigating, with a diary and mobile phone recovered from the puja room.

title: T20 World Cup: Pak captain on India boycott - 'There are three other matches'
summary: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha reiterated that the decision to skip the India match at the T20 World Cup rests entirely with the Pakistani government. While acknowledging fans will miss the marquee clash, Agha stressed the team’s focus is on the remaining group games.

title: Epstein files: Not Trump, but this world leader may lose his job
summary: The Jeffrey Epstein scandal is creating political pressure for UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer over his past appointment of Peter Mandelson, who is now under criminal investigation.  Meanwhile, US President Donald Trump faces no immediate threat despite his name appearing in Epstein files, highlighting differing political environments and institutional responses to the ongoing global fallout.

title: JP Morgan & some other world’s biggest analysts and CEOs to stock markets worldwide: You are wrong..
summary: Wall Street's tech stock sell-off following Anthropic's AI launch is deemed 'overblown' by JPMorgan strategists and tech leaders like Nvidia's Jensen Huang and Google's Sundar Pichai.  Market commentator Jim Cramer also believes software decline is exaggerated. Experts argue AI will enhance, not replace, existing software tools, suggesting a healthy market rotation rather than fundamental decline.

title: India-US trade deal: Joint statement in 4–5 days; agreement likely by mid-March, says Goyal
summary: India and the US are set to finalize the first tranche of their bilateral trade agreement, with a joint statement expected within days. This deal, under negotiation since early 2025, aims to boost two-way trade to $500 billion by 2030, with India safeguarding sensitive sectors like agriculture and dairy.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K, 24K gold costs in your city? Check rates
summary: Precious metals experienced a sharp downturn on Thursday, reversing recent gains as futures faced significant selling pressure. Weak global sentiment and a stronger US dollar contributed to the decline. Silver futures on MCX plunged by 10%, while gold futures also saw a notable drop, erasing previous recovery.

title: Dell sued by 5 ex-employees; complaint alleges that the company mismanaged its 401(k) plan
summary: Five ex-Dell employees are suing the tech giant, alleging its 401(k) plan mismanagement cost workers over $318 million. The lawsuit claims Dell violated federal law by keeping workers in underperforming investment funds while profiting from its own products.  This class action seeks to recover losses and reform the retirement plan's operations.

title: Gambhir visits Siddhivinayak, seeks blessings ahead of T20 World Cup
summary: Ahead of their T20 World Cup title defense, head coach Gautam Gambhir and batting coach Sitanshu Kotak sought blessings at the Shree Siddhivinayak Temple. India, led by Suryakumar Yadav, enters the tournament as strong favorites, aiming to become the first team to successfully defend the men's T20 World Cup title.
